commit_message: Additional cleanup of resources to avoid open file problems: remove SAMDataSource readers
Use GATK 2.6.5 with custom close method to avoid open file handles
Cleanup leaking BAMSchedule file handles by ensuring closing of ShardBalancers associated with views. Requires custom version of GATK 2.6 with close methods on ShardBalanacer
Correctly setup inverse mappings for UCSC to Ensembl conversions
Provide remapping of UCSC/Ensembl coordinates between BED inputs and reference files used for alignment
Ensure agents are shutdown during failed parallel processing runs; avoids lockups
Ensure out file passed along for chaining transcript retrieval and exon identification
Provide retrieval of transcript exons by name for whole organisms. Parallelize by chromosome with re-start points. Re-work parallelization of coordinate retrieval to work in batches
Refactor ensembl retrieval code into separate module as start for providing additional query capacity
Provide hooks to limit transcript coverage to canonical transcripts only instead of all exons
Updates to WGS versus exome configuration and sorting of comparison output
Provide workflow to compare coverage across multiple experiments and approaches
Enable parallelization of remote Ensembl queries for gene coordinates
Work around issue with jEnsembl/Ensembl transcript to coordinate mapping which creates exon regions spanning introns
Format coverage and average reads to make CSV output interpretation easier
Handle non-primary gene name lookup from Ensembl by also querying for known synonyms
Fixes for retrieval of translated coding regions: avoid non-coding transcripts and upstream/downstream UTRs, correctly handle negative strand features in retrieval and preparation
Parallelize retrieval of coverage at specific genomic variant regions
Improve cleanup of GATK resources to ensure closing of all open file handles
Cleanup for output information: better chart labeling, improve CSV header information and only report average coverage in regions that pass minimum threshold
Rework BAM iterators to reuse GATK interals more heavily. Hopefully will allow faster seeking to regions in large BAM input files. Also allow generalization to multiple input locations
Provide parameters for downsampling input files to avoid excessive coverage regions
Enable parallelization by genomic regions over multicore machines to speed up coverage identification steps

Rework approach to coverage retrieval to use GATK pileup mechanism instead of individual read retrieval. Add in iterator which simplifies getting GATK AlignmentContexts without needing to go through full map/reduce walker framework
Move reducer based parallel code to separate namespace
Enable parallelization by BAM position using separate readers for each query, avoiding multi-threading conflicts
Fixes for reducer-based parallelization and running charts in no-X server environments
Parallelize intial source preparation to handle concurrent BAM indexing. Write BAM indexes to temporary files. Additional improvements to reduce-based parallelization
Ensure BAM indexes are up to date during retrieval preparation
Parallelize retrieval of coverage to utilize multiple cores
Fixes to handle multiple input BAMs and better error messages for gene names not found in Ensembl
Finalize reporting of coverage changes as CSV file of raw values and scatter plot of summarized differences
Formalize coverage and variant reports for WGS/exome comparisons, producing finalized data structure.
Additional expansion of framework for wgs and exome comparion. Flesh out configuration format, add test approach, and provide framework for sample reports of interest
Sketch out initial framework to specify and query whole genome versus summarized exome data
Retrieve coverage from multiple input files to handle population level BAM inputs
Provide retrieval of variants from ESP combined VCF files by region and allele frequency
Convert gene input names into BED files with coordinates of collapsed exonic regions
Provide reading of coverage information from BigWig files, based on ESP test examples
Convert ESP coverage data into bigwig format for indexed retrieval by region
Identify and report sequence blocks with low coverage to help prioritizing genes with missing coverage
Initial framework for assessing variant coverage across regions of interest in variant calling experiments
